1290641465449270.title: Research Scientist Intern, Spatial Audio Capture and Reproduction (PhD)
1290641465449270.responsibilities: Design and implementation of novel algorithms to solve audio research problems Experimental design, implementation, and execution to evaluate new audio technologies Collaboration with and support of other researchers across audio and acoustic engineering disciplines Communication of research agenda, progress, and results
1290641465449270.minimum_qualifications: 1+ years experience working with spatial audio capture algorithms Expertise in one or more of the below research areas: Audio signal processing, Binaural audio technology, Microphone array processing, Machine learning for spatial audio applications, Beamforming, Spatial audio evaluation, Spatial audio coding Coding experience in one or more languages, including but not limited to: C/C++, C#, Python, Max/MSP, or MATLAB Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment Is in the process of obtaining a PhD degree in the field of Acoustics, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related STEM fields
1290641465449270.preferred_qualifications: Experience with real-time multichannel audio processing and coding Experience with machine learning software platforms such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc Experience with Unity, Unreal, CryEngine, or similar game engines Proven track record of achieving results as demonstrated in accepted papers in top conferences or journals such as ICASSP, WASPAA, InterSpeech, JASA, JAES, etc Experience working and communicating cross functionally in a team environment Intent to return to a degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
